meanings.definition: To dig or excavate with a tool
meanings.sent1: I will howk the soil to plant the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist used a shovel to howk for ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The determined squirrel decided to howk for buried acorns in the garden.
meanings.sent4: She howked through the sand like a treasure hunter seeking gold.
meanings.sent5: The children watched in awe as the construction workers howked through the ground.

meanings.definition: To search or rummage through something
meanings.sent1: Let's howk through the closet to find your missing toy.
meanings.sent2: The detective had to howk through the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat began to howk through the pile of leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent4: She howked through her memories to recall the forgotten name.
meanings.sent5: The students eagerly howked through the library for information on their project.

meanings.sent1: He had to howk hard to remove the stubborn weed from the ground.
meanings.sent2: The child tried to howk the toy out from under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The strong winds howked at the branches of the tree.
meanings.sent4: She had to howk at the stuck zipper to open her bag.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman had to howk the fishing line to reel in a big catch.
